page.title: 06SCHOOLS, THE LAW, AND CHURCH
page.content: School age children are taken by bus to either Aylburton for primary and junior education or into Lydney for comprehensive education. Policing of the area is also very poor. Again there is no police station or resident policeman for the village. Fortunately there is a very low crime rate, the Police come in from Lydney when required. Crime, when committed is dealt with at Lydney Court Sessions. The area is visited regularly by Police Patrol Cars. St. Andrews Church, circa 1250, denomination Church of England, stands in the centre of the village. It is the only place of worship and church services are poorly attended. The vicar is shared with the nearby parish of Woolaston.
